intro: Brassica rapa f. glabra, commonly known as the field mustard, is an annual plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves and yellow flowers that form in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and thrives in disturbed soils and open areas. Its seeds are small and can remain viable in the soil for several years. This species is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides, where it can become a weed.
